intro: Zinowiewia integerrima, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of soft, fuzzy hairs. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Zinowiewia integerrima is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain regions.
